JD001.title: Data Analyst
JD001.description: Key Responsibilities:Data collection and storage:Gathering data from various sources and organising it in a structured manner to ensure efficient and secure data storage.Data analysis:Employ advanced data and process modelling techniques to identify, investigate, and analyse trends, patterns, and insights that can be utilized to make informed business decisions.Data quality and integrity:Ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and reliability of the data. Conducting data cleaning and validation to maintain high-quality data that can be trusted for analysis and decision-making.Reporting and visualisation:Presenting data findings in a clear and concise manner. Creating dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate insights effectively and facilitate decision-making within the company.Collaboration and cross-functional support:Collaborating with teams across the company, such as product or operations, to understand their data needs and provide analytical support.Strategic Support: Participate in the development and implementation of data-related strategies and initiatives to support business objectives and drive growth.Internal Guidance:Provide support and guidance to internal teams on data-related issues, including best practices for data management, analysis, and interpretation.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.1 - 3 years’ experience using using PowerBI, SQL and Excel and strong reporting and data visualisation skills. Some exposure to Python is beneficial.Strong analytical and quantitative skills.Ability to analyse complex financial data sets and present findings in a clear and concise manner to facilitate informed decision-making.Strong attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

JD002.title: Python Developer
JD002.description: Candidate requirementsThese are the minimum requirements a candidate must meet to be considered for this role.Proficiency in Python with a strong understanding of backend development practices.Experience working with Web3 technologies, including interacting with smart contracts, decentralized applications, and blockchain protocols.Familiarity with Python libraries for blockchain development, such as Web3.py, Brownie, or Py-Ethers.Solid experience building RESTful APIs and integrating them with external systems or blockchain platforms.Experience developing automation bots for interacting with Web3 platforms (e.g., automated trading, monitoring, event-driven actions).Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and design patterns.Familiarity with version control (e.g., Git) and modern development practices (e.g., CI/CD).Ability to work with Docker, Kubernetes, or cloud platforms like AWS or GCP is a plus.Knowledge of smart contract development, especially deployment, testing, and integration in Ethereum or similar networks.Job responsibilitiesDesign and implement backend APIs using Python to interact with decentralized networks and smart contracts.Develop automation bots to interact with blockchain protocols, automate transactions, monitor events, and manage wallet interactions.Build tooling for smart contract deployment, upgrades, and testing, streamlining the development lifecycle.Integrate with blockchain platforms like Ethereum, Binance Smart Chain (BSC), Polygon, or others via Python libraries like Web3.py, Brownie, or Ethers.js.Collaborate closely with frontend developers, smart contract developers, and DevOps engineers to deliver a seamless experience across all layers of the tech stack.Optimize code for performance, scalability, and security within the context of Web3 applications.Maintain and improve existing code, while ensuring compatibility with evolving blockchain standards.Write automated tests for backend services, bots, and smart contract interactions.Stay up to date with emerging trends and best practices in the Python and blockchain space.

JD003.title: AI Engineer
JD003.description: About UsWe are a fast growth Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) SaaS business. At Protecht, we are at the forefront of innovation, integrating cutting-edge AI technologies into our SaaS application, Protecht.ERM, and across our entire business. Our mission is to revolutionize enterprise risk management by leveraging AI to provide unparalleled insights and efficiencies.The opportunityAt Protecht, we believe that the future of risk management is intelligent, adaptive, and AI-driven. As anAI Engineerat Protecht, your mission is to redefine how organizations manage risk by embedding intelligent, autonomous, and conversational AI capabilities into our enterprise platform,Protecht.ERM.You will play a pivotal role in designing and delivering next-generation AI features that empower users to make smarter, faster, and safer decisions.Located in our central Sydney office (hybrid work from home option available) and reporting to our Head of Business Delivery you will drive the delivery of AI projects across the business.What You'll DoCollaborate with product managers, analysts, and engineers to define and deliver impactful AI use casesArchitect and implement scalable Generative AI features, including agentic workflows, conversational AI, and autonomous agentsIntegrate AI into our enterprise stack using ReactJS (frontend) and Java (backend)Leverage AWS Bedrock services (Agents, Flows, Knowledge Bases, Guardrails, etc.) to build secure and compliant AI solutionsApply best practices in AI security, including mitigation of hallucinations, prompt injection, and biasMentor engineers and champion excellence in AI developmentConduct code reviews, troubleshoot complex issues, and ensure high-quality, maintainable codeWhat You’ll Bring2+ years of hands-on experience in Generative AI and Agentic AI development5+ years in commercial SaaS product development using Java, ReactJS, and modern databasesDeep knowledge of RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), vector databases, and custom embeddingsProficiency in prompt engineering, benchmarking, and AI performance optimizationStrong understanding of AI ethics, governance, and security risks in enterprise environmentsExperience with LangChain, OpenAI APIs, or similar LLM frameworks (highly desirable)Familiarity with Spring Framework, Microservices, Kubernetes, and CI/CD pipelinesExcellent communication skills and a collaborative mindsetExperience with Bitbucket, DevOps, and cloud infrastructurePassion for solving complex problems and driving innovation in AITertiary qualifications in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related fieldsWhy Protecht?At Protecht, a positive and super friendly culture awaits you, where learning is valued and supported. We empower our people through leadership, training, knowledge-sharing, and mentorship. Here are some of the perks of working with Protecht:A highly flexible culture – our way of working lets people work across home and our officesA strong commitment to your learning and development - fortnightly dedicated L&D afternoonsReward & Recognition programsA strong focus on work / life balance with access to Birthday leave, bonus days, paid parental leave and long service leaveMonthly social eventsCompetitive remuneration | Annual Performance Bonus | Novated Car LeasingGenerous Employee Referral programSounds like you?If you are Ready to build the future of AI in enterprise risk management!Apply online today!Visit our website https://www.protechtgroup.com/ to find out a little more about working with us.Powered by JazzHRUL1VL9aNI7

JD004.title: AI/ML Engineer
JD004.description: Description We’re seeking a driven and experienced AI/ML Engineer to help drive the integration of Artificial Intelligence into our SaaS platform for professional services. This is a critical role that will shape how AI delivers meaningful value to our users - enabling smarter workflows, insightful automation, and a competitive edge. In this role, you’ll design and build intelligent systems that match the right resources to the right tasks, generate optimised schedules, and summarise project statuses using the latest in applied machine learning and large language models. The ideal candidate is comfortable navigating both the science and the engineering required to deliver reliable, production-grade AI solutions that make a real impact. Key Responsibilities Design, develop, and deploy ML models for real-world SaaS features, such as forecasting, smart scheduling, and recommendation systems. Design, implement, and optimise solutions leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) from providers such as OpenAI, Hugging Face, and Anthropic, incorporating advanced capabilities including additional training, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and reasoning. Collaborate cross-functionally with product, engineering, and design teams to identify opportunities to embed ML into the product experience. Build robust data pipelines (ETL/ELT), ensuring high-quality data availability for modeling and analytics. Evaluate and optimise model performance to ensure transparency, fairness, and trust in AI-driven features, while adhering to budgetary constraints. Lead the development of MLOps workflows for versioning, deployment, monitoring, and retraining of production models. Translate ambiguous product problems into well-defined ML problems with measurable success metrics. Communicate insights and technical decisions clearly to non-technical stakeholders. Mentor engineers to strengthen their skills in AI/ML development, deployment, and best practices.Qualifications Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, Engineering, or related field. 3–5+ years of experience in ML or data science roles, preferably in a SaaS or technology environment. Demonstrated success shipping ML features in production environments.Skills & Experience Core AI/ML Expertise Proficiency with ML frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, and Scikit-learn. Strong experience with supervised and unsupervised learning, NLP, and time-series forecasting. Hands-on experience deploying LLMs for real-world applications, including fine-tuning, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), reasoning, and Mixture of Experts techniques. Familiarity with prompt engineering, chaining methods, and higher-level orchestration frameworks such as LangChain and LlamaIndex. Understanding of multimodal learning, integrating diverse data types (e.g., text, images, audio) to enhance model performance.Product-Oriented Thinking Experience integrating ML into user-facing SaaS features. Ability to frame business and user problems as ML problems. Deep understanding of user experience considerations such as explainability, latency, and trust.Data Infrastructure & MLOps Proficient in working with production-grade data pipelines (SQL/NoSQL, ETL/ELT, data lakes). Experience with ML model deployment using tools like Docker, FastAPI, and cloud platforms (AWS or GCP). Familiarity with MLOps tools such as MLflow, Airflow, n8n, or Feature Stores.Collaboration & Communication Strong cross-functional collaboration skills; comfortable working with product managers, designers, and engineers. Effective communicator, capable of explaining technical concepts to a variety of audiences. Agile mindset with a willingness to prototype, test, and iterate based on user feedback.Bonus Skills Knowledge of the Professional Services Automation domain or related verticals (e.g., project management, time tracking). Experience with RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) or vector search for intelligent document Q&A. Background in optimization or recommendation algorithms (e.g., prioritization, resource allocation).Where You’ll Be This role is based in Wollongong, with the flexibility to work from home two days a week. You’ll be joining a global team with colleagues across Australia, the Philippines, and the United States. Working at Accelo At Accelo, innovation, collaboration, and impact go hand-in-hand. We're a growing SaaS company on a mission to help professional service businesses succeed - and we’re just getting started. We believe bold thinking and smart risks lead to better outcomes. That’s why we’ve built a collaborative, inclusive environment where diverse perspectives are welcomed, supported, and celebrated. Your ideas won’t just be heard - they’ll directly shape the future of our platform. What We Offer Supportive & Talented Team: Work alongside driven, curious, and kind people who genuinely care about what they do - and about each other. Office Environment: Enjoy our centrally located, pet-friendly office with easy access to public transport, a fully stocked kitchen, snacks, fresh fruit, and a coffee & tea bar. Hybrid Work Flexibility: We trust our people to do their best work - wherever that may be - with a hybrid model that supports work-life balance. Performance-Based Bonus Plan: Be recognised and rewarded for your contributions. Life Events Program: Celebrate the moments that matter - big and small. Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Access free, confidential support for your mental, emotional, and physical wellbeing. Quarterly Recognition Awards: We shine a spotlight on team members who go above and beyond - whether through impact, leadership, or customer advocacy.We’re proud to foster a diverse and inclusive culture. We know that bringing together different backgrounds and perspectives leads to better decisions, stronger collaboration, and a more innovative company. A Few Things to Know You must have the right to work in Australia - we are not able to offer sponsorship for this role. We are an equal opportunity employer and warmly welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds.About Accelo Founded in 2011 in Wollongong, Accelo is a growing SaaS company with 80+ team members across Australia, the US, and the Philippines. We help professional service businesses - like digital agencies, consultants, and engineers - spend less time managing work and more time doing what they love. Our platform streamlines scheduling, time tracking, billing, and collaboration into one smart system that empowers teams to thrive - no matter where they work. At Accelo, we’re passionate about building great software, celebrating individuality, and working together to solve real problems.

JD006.title: Machine Learning Engineer
JD006.description: A leading technology company is seeking the strongest Machine Learning Engineers in the market with strong experience with PyTorch as they scale their team with several opportunities available. You will play a key role in developing advanced deep learning systems, contributing across the full MLOps pipeline.You’ll help to build and maintain a robust MLOps infrastructure and contribute to leading AI & ML models. Your work will support mission-critical applications, with a focus on dataset design, synthetic data generation, and performance benchmarking of deep learning models.Location-Sydney (Hybrid)What You'll Do:Design, improve, and maintain scalable MLOps pipelines for computer vision workflowsBuild systems for data collection, curation, and quality reviewImplement automated Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) toolsCreate and manage synthetic data generation pipelinesDevelop and refine data sampling and benchmarking methodsPerform hyper-parameter optimisation (HPO) and model tuningExperiment with and optimise deep learning architectures for visual recognition tasksWhat You'll Bring:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field (or equivalent industry experience)Hands-on experience in machine learning engineering, with a focus on MLOps and dataset managementStrong proficiency in PythonPractical experience with deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlowFamiliarity with MLOps tools (SageMaker preferred), monitoring frameworks, and pipeline automationExperience generating and working with synthetic dataThis is an incredible opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology for one of the leading technology companies in Australia.Please Note -Applicants must have full relevant working rights to be consideredIf you have any questions about this role or others we have available you can email our team directly via data@thedrivegroup.com.auFor The Latest Jobs, Tech News or to 'Introduce A Friend' for a $1000 Referral Fee - Follow Us On Linkedin:https://www.linkedin.com/company/thedrivegroupTheDriveGroup is 100% committed to improving meaningful diversity in the technology industry.We partner with clients who embrace diversity and seek candidates across all backgrounds, abilities, genders, sexualities, cultures, and faiths.If you have the right skills and attitude we would love to hear from you!

JD007.title: Data Scientist
JD007.description: We’re Jetstar. You may know us for our famous low fares, but did you also know that we’ve flown more than 400 million customers since we launched in Australia in 2004? In fact, each week we operate around 3,000 flights to nearly 40 destinations across Australia, New Zealand, Asia and the Pacific. We also operate a fleet of more than 80 aircraft, including state-of-the-art Airbus A320/21 NEO aircraft and the Airbus A320 family and Boeing 787-8s. Every day we enable more people to takeoff to more places, more often.Impressive numbers? What's even more impressive is the team of extraordinary people taking off together day in day out, flight after flight.Our people are the real jet stars!Job DescriptionJoin and shape a growing Pricing and Revenue Management Team at Jetstar TechnologyFlexible working options availablePermanent role based in our Collingwood head office in Melbourne CBDJetstar thrives on innovation! We are always looking to employ ambitious and proactive professionals to help our business work smarter and more efficiently. You will be encouraged to think innovatively whilst developing and maintaining best practice. What’s more, this role will see you working as part of a broader group Jetstar and Qantas structure.TheData Scientistwill form a core part of the PRM function within Jetstar. This role will perform analysis on our rich data set to drive powerful insight and create competitive advantage in our markets.The Data Scientist will work very closely to the Senior Analysts in Pricing & Revenue Management, across the Qantas group, the Ancillary team and the Data Analytics team in order to define pricing elasticity and ideal price points.This role will be heavily involved in enabling the successful implementation and continual enhancements of a new data science driven forecasting and optimisation system for Jetstar.In addition to the above, in the role you will be required to:Analyse, identify and describe relationships and patterns in dataStretch yourself to enhance current data science forecasting and price optimisation models or discover and create new technology and methodologiesPro-actively identify commercially valuable opportunities and define related hypothesesDiscuss data meaning and complexity with peers throughout the businessActively engage stakeholders in the organization to understand their business problem, their data requirements and what they are looking to achieveOwn processes and systems created from start to finish, leaning to more efficient and automated processesWork alongside the Pricing and Revenue Management team across Jetstar and QantasKey role in supporting the culture of data-driven, customer centric decision making across JetstarTo Be Considered For This Role You Will HaveTertiary degree (or equivalent experience) in a highly analytical discipline (e.g. statistics, mathematics, physics, computer science, engineering)Minimum three years’ experience in competitive consumer retail markets such as energy, financial services, insurance, telecommunications or airlinesProven track record of leading the Analytics capability within a data-driven environmentProficient with statistical test methods (T-test, ANOVA, A/B testing methods)Strong problem-solving skills, commercial acumen and negotiating skillsAbility to present insights and analysis in non-technical language and influence senior decision makers within the businessFamiliarity with cloud environment (eg AWS) and ability to analyse large sets of dataDemonstrable experience with programming languages for machine learning (SQL, Python, R, MATLAB, etc.)Proficient with advanced analytical techniques such as classification, regression and similarity matching and other machine learning and data science techniques.First class communication and presentation skills and the ability to inspire a highly functional teamThis is a challenging role and we will expect great results from the successful applicants. In return you will get to be part of a smart, driven, high performing team with real opportunities for you to make your mark and build your career within a great organisation in an exciting industry.Our CultureJetstar is alive with a sense of adventure. Day in and day out, our teams search for new places to fly, new ways to add value and new ideas to improve performance. If you love the road less travelled, you’ll love working here because ours is a team who innovate every day, thrive on delivery, support each other and celebrate our successes. You’ll be supported to challenge, anticipate and explore while you work will connect people and enrich lives. We encourage diversity and aim to create an environment where our employees feel valued, respected and enabled.Applications close on Monday the 14th of JulyYour Life At Jetstar Is Unlike Any Other..Live the travel dream:You and your nominated travel companions can take-off more with our famous Qantas Group Staff Travel discount.Make work feel like a holiday:Join a fun, driven team where work feels like a holiday. Our people take every opportunity to take-off together and find ways to help their teammates soar.There’s a place for everyone at Jetstar:For us, travel and meeting new people go hand in hand. We invite our people to get involved in various Employee Network Groups that play an important role in creating our inclusive and supportive culture that we are fiercely proud of. We believe that teams with a diversity of ideas and experiences are more creative, innovative and solve problems quickly. We welcome applications from anyone who wants to take-off with us. If you have support or access requirements, just reach out and let us know what you need.

Follow Us On Linkedin:</p><p> </p><p>https://www.linkedin.com/company/thedrivegroup</p><p> </p><p><em>TheDriveGroup is 100% committed to improving meaningful diversity in the technology industry.</em></p><p> </p><p><em>We partner with clients who embrace diversity and seek candidates across all backgrounds, abilities, genders, sexualities, cultures, and faiths.</em></p><p> </p><p><em>If you have the right skills and attitude we would love to hear from you!</em></p>","employmentType":"FULL_TIME","hiringOrganization":{"@type":"Organization","name":"TheDriveGroup","sameAs":"https://au.linkedin.com/company/thedrivegroup","logo":"https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/v2/D560BAQGlmANa3Nm84g/company-logo_200_200/B56ZfIOvK2G0AM-/0/1751410996377/thedrivegroup_logo?e=2147483647&v=beta&t=-Hy_FM2o0MNhtxO0aDWbBkNfDjhCHckQ8EytpPAYNP8"},"identifier":{"@type":"PropertyValue","name":"TheDriveGroup"},"image":"https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/v2/D560BAQGlmANa3Nm84g/company-logo_100_100/B56ZfIOvK2G0AU-/0/1751410996377/thedrivegroup_logo?e=2147483647&v=beta&t=kEq4AGN9i3VF8J2zsUzsrCSjK5UdhE1QTWCs1x8kqC0","industry":"Staffing and Recruiting","jobLocation":{"@type":"Place","address":{"@type":"PostalAddress","addressCountry":"AU","addressLocality":"Sydney","addressRegion":"NSW","streetAddress":null},"latitude":-33.8732,"longitude":151.2096},"skills":"","title":"Machine Learning Engineer","validThrough":"2025-08-06T09:11:51.000Z","educationRequirements":{"@type":"EducationalOccupationalCredential","credentialCategory":"bachelor degree"}}

JD009.title: AI/ML Engineer
JD009.description: Description We’re seeking a driven and experienced AI/ML Engineer to help drive the integration of Artificial Intelligence into our SaaS platform for professional services. This is a critical role that will shape how AI delivers meaningful value to our users - enabling smarter workflows, insightful automation, and a competitive edge. In this role, you’ll design and build intelligent systems that match the right resources to the right tasks, generate optimised schedules, and summarise project statuses using the latest in applied machine learning and large language models. The ideal candidate is comfortable navigating both the science and the engineering required to deliver reliable, production-grade AI solutions that make a real impact. Key Responsibilities Design, develop, and deploy ML models for real-world SaaS features, such as forecasting, smart scheduling, and recommendation systems. Design, implement, and optimise solutions leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) from providers such as OpenAI, Hugging Face, and Anthropic, incorporating advanced capabilities including additional training, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and reasoning. Collaborate cross-functionally with product, engineering, and design teams to identify opportunities to embed ML into the product experience. Build robust data pipelines (ETL/ELT), ensuring high-quality data availability for modeling and analytics. Evaluate and optimise model performance to ensure transparency, fairness, and trust in AI-driven features, while adhering to budgetary constraints. Lead the development of MLOps workflows for versioning, deployment, monitoring, and retraining of production models. Translate ambiguous product problems into well-defined ML problems with measurable success metrics. Communicate insights and technical decisions clearly to non-technical stakeholders. Mentor engineers to strengthen their skills in AI/ML development, deployment, and best practices.Qualifications Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, Engineering, or related field. 3–5+ years of experience in ML or data science roles, preferably in a SaaS or technology environment. Demonstrated success shipping ML features in production environments.Skills & Experience Core AI/ML Expertise Proficiency with ML frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, and Scikit-learn. Strong experience with supervised and unsupervised learning, NLP, and time-series forecasting. Hands-on experience deploying LLMs for real-world applications, including fine-tuning, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), reasoning, and Mixture of Experts techniques. Familiarity with prompt engineering, chaining methods, and higher-level orchestration frameworks such as LangChain and LlamaIndex. Understanding of multimodal learning, integrating diverse data types (e.g., text, images, audio) to enhance model performance.Product-Oriented Thinking Experience integrating ML into user-facing SaaS features. Ability to frame business and user problems as ML problems. Deep understanding of user experience considerations such as explainability, latency, and trust.Data Infrastructure & MLOps Proficient in working with production-grade data pipelines (SQL/NoSQL, ETL/ELT, data lakes). Experience with ML model deployment using tools like Docker, FastAPI, and cloud platforms (AWS or GCP). Familiarity with MLOps tools such as MLflow, Airflow, n8n, or Feature Stores.Collaboration & Communication Strong cross-functional collaboration skills; comfortable working with product managers, designers, and engineers. Effective communicator, capable of explaining technical concepts to a variety of audiences. Agile mindset with a willingness to prototype, test, and iterate based on user feedback.Bonus Skills Knowledge of the Professional Services Automation domain or related verticals (e.g., project management, time tracking). Experience with RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) or vector search for intelligent document Q&A. Background in optimization or recommendation algorithms (e.g., prioritization, resource allocation).Where You’ll Be This role is based in Wollongong, with the flexibility to work from home two days a week. You’ll be joining a global team with colleagues across Australia, the Philippines, and the United States. Working at Accelo At Accelo, innovation, collaboration, and impact go hand-in-hand. We're a growing SaaS company on a mission to help professional service businesses succeed - and we’re just getting started. We believe bold thinking and smart risks lead to better outcomes. That’s why we’ve built a collaborative, inclusive environment where diverse perspectives are welcomed, supported, and celebrated. Your ideas won’t just be heard - they’ll directly shape the future of our platform. What We Offer Supportive & Talented Team: Work alongside driven, curious, and kind people who genuinely care about what they do - and about each other. Office Environment: Enjoy our centrally located, pet-friendly office with easy access to public transport, a fully stocked kitchen, snacks, fresh fruit, and a coffee & tea bar. Hybrid Work Flexibility: We trust our people to do their best work - wherever that may be - with a hybrid model that supports work-life balance. Performance-Based Bonus Plan: Be recognised and rewarded for your contributions. Life Events Program: Celebrate the moments that matter - big and small. Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Access free, confidential support for your mental, emotional, and physical wellbeing. Quarterly Recognition Awards: We shine a spotlight on team members who go above and beyond - whether through impact, leadership, or customer advocacy.We’re proud to foster a diverse and inclusive culture. We know that bringing together different backgrounds and perspectives leads to better decisions, stronger collaboration, and a more innovative company. A Few Things to Know You must have the right to work in Australia - we are not able to offer sponsorship for this role. We are an equal opportunity employer and warmly welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds.About Accelo Founded in 2011 in Wollongong, Accelo is a growing SaaS company with 80+ team members across Australia, the US, and the Philippines. We help professional service businesses - like digital agencies, consultants, and engineers - spend less time managing work and more time doing what they love. Our platform streamlines scheduling, time tracking, billing, and collaboration into one smart system that empowers teams to thrive - no matter where they work. At Accelo, we’re passionate about building great software, celebrating individuality, and working together to solve real problems.

JD010.title: Data Analyst
JD010.description: Key Responsibilities:Data collection and storage:Gathering data from various sources and organising it in a structured manner to ensure efficient and secure data storage.Data analysis:Employ advanced data and process modelling techniques to identify, investigate, and analyse trends, patterns, and insights that can be utilized to make informed business decisions.Data quality and integrity:Ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and reliability of the data. Conducting data cleaning and validation to maintain high-quality data that can be trusted for analysis and decision-making.Reporting and visualisation:Presenting data findings in a clear and concise manner. Creating dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate insights effectively and facilitate decision-making within the company.Collaboration and cross-functional support:Collaborating with teams across the company, such as product or operations, to understand their data needs and provide analytical support.Strategic Support: Participate in the development and implementation of data-related strategies and initiatives to support business objectives and drive growth.Internal Guidance:Provide support and guidance to internal teams on data-related issues, including best practices for data management, analysis, and interpretation.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.1 - 3 years’ experience using using PowerBI, SQL and Excel and strong reporting and data visualisation skills. Some exposure to Python is beneficial.Strong analytical and quantitative skills.Ability to analyse complex financial data sets and present findings in a clear and concise manner to facilitate informed decision-making.Strong attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

JD011.title: Expression of Interest - Feature Animation, Crowds, Sydney
JD011.description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with 283 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.Netflix Animation Studios (NAS) is on a mission to entertain the world with bold, immersive animated films that are timeless and impactful. We are paving the way for the future of animation by building a community of amazing artists and talent. As a part of Netflix, NAS values innovation, ownership, courage, inclusion, and collaboration. This is the new wave of animation — and you can help shape it!Interested?Do you want to join the Netflix Animation Studios team, but don't see a current role posted within the Crowds Department in Sydney that you'd like to apply for?Submit your information and/or portfolio to our database so we can consider you for roles in the future. If there’s a match to an upcoming role, a member of our Talent Team will be in touch with you!Inclusion is a Netflix value and we strive to host a meaningful interview experience for all candidates. If you want an accommodation/adjustment for a disability or any other reason during the hiring process, please send a request to your recruiting partner.We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.Job is open for no less than 7 days and will be removed when the position is filled.

JD012.title: Data Analyst - Full Time - Cheltenham
JD012.description: Join Melba Support Services as a Data Analyst - Full Time Hybrid OpportunityMelba Support Services is seeking an experienced and detail-drivenData Analystto join our passionate team. This is apermanent full-time hybrid role, offering the flexibility to work from home and from one of our vibrant offices located inCheltenham or Lilydale. If you're ready to make a meaningful impact by transforming data into insights that support people with disabilities to live a fabulous life, we'd love to hear from you.Working at Melba Support Services (Melba)We support people with disability to live the life they want.We have a Zero Tolerance approach to violence, abuse, neglect, and exploitation.Every member of the Melba community is committed to The Melba Way Charter, our vision, purpose and values.Melba aims to create welcoming and respectful workplaces that promote inclusive and collaborative working relationships.About MelbaFor over 50 years Melba Support Services has been providing services to people with disability. We are a registered provider who focus on supporting people to dream big, embrace life and do what they choose and value.Our commitment to human rights for all people living with disability underpins everything we do. We support people to achieve the goals they choose and live the life that they want, the person comes first!Melba won the 2023 National Disability Award for Excellence in Service Quality.What is the Melba Way?Melba's approach is built on a human rights values-based framework. Our purpose is to open up a world of opportunities for people to live a fabulous life. The Melba Way' is how we go about doing this.Each person is individual and unique.The Melba Way honours and sustains this by creating, maintaining, and refining individualised person-led service, minute by minute, hour by hour and day by day.We do this one person at a time.Position PurposeWorking under the direction of the Head of Data & Insights this position will build, test and continuously improve the data platform and analytics capability within Melba. Collaborating with key stakeholders this position will focus on translating business needs into actionable data solutions by developing, enhancing, and maintaining robust data platforms, reporting tools, and visualisations. The role will also support strategic decision-making and operational efficiency by gathering requirements, analysing data, automating workflows, and ensuring data governance, while promoting continuous improvement and alignment with business objectives.What You'll Be Doing (Key Accountabilities)Stakeholder Engagement & Requirements GatheringCollaborate with stakeholders to identify business challenges and translate them into data and insights to support data based decision makingCollaborate with key stakeholders and departments during system implementations to define reporting needs and identify the most effective solutions.Partner with technical and non-technical teams to ensure shared understanding of requirements, data, and goals for alignment on delivery. Collaborate closely with the Head of Data & Insights to support strategic priorities and ensure that platform enhancements align with business objectives.Data Platform Development & EnhancementGather, clean, and analyse data from various sources to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.Perform exploratory data analysis to support strategic and operational decision-making.Monitor and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) to provide visibility into business performance.Write clean, modular Python code to automate data processing tasks and integrate disparate data sources.Build reusable scripts and functions to support ad hoc and automated reporting needs.Collaborate with BI developers and analysts to align backend data models with dashboard/reporting requirements.Proactively identify and implement opportunities to optimise data workflows, automate manual processes, and improve system integration.Document code, workflows, and data definitions to support platform maintainability and knowledge sharing.Reporting & VisualisationDesign and deliver dashboards, reports, and visualisations aligned to stakeholder needs.Support the design and implementation of data models, KPIs, and reporting solutions.Ensure that all reports and analyses comply with company policies and industry standards.Process Improvement & Data GovernanceIdentify opportunities to streamline data collection and reporting processes to improve efficiency and accuracy.Contribute to the continuous improvement of data quality, data literacy, and reporting standards across the organisation.Testing & DocumentationAssist with User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and validation of data solutions before deployment.Document business processes, data flows, and analytical requirements to support transparency and knowledge sharing.Your Background (Skills And Attributes)Bachelor's degree in business, Finance, Statistics, or a related field.Proven experience as a Business JD012.requirements: {"@context":"http://schema.org","@type":"JobPosting","datePosted":"2025-07-02T04:24:39.000Z","description":"<strong>Join Melba Support Services as a Data Analyst - Full Time Hybrid Opportunity<br><br></strong>Melba Support Services is seeking an experienced and detail-driven <strong>Data Analyst</strong> to join our passionate team. This is a <strong>permanent full-time hybrid role</strong>, offering the flexibility to work from home and from one of our vibrant offices located in <strong>Cheltenham or Lilydale</strong>. If you're ready to make a meaningful impact by transforming data into insights that support people with disabilities to live a fabulous life, we'd love to hear from you.<br><br><strong>Working at Melba Support Services (Melba) <br><br></strong><ul><li>We support people with disability to live the life they want. </li><li>We have a Zero Tolerance approach to violence, abuse, neglect, and exploitation. </li><li>Every member of the Melba community is committed to The Melba Way Charter, our vision, purpose and values. </li><li>Melba aims to create welcoming and respectful workplaces that promote inclusive and collaborative working relationships. <br><br></li></ul><strong>About Melba<br><br></strong>For over 50 years Melba Support Services has been providing services to people with disability. We are a registered provider who focus on supporting people to dream big, embrace life and do what they choose and value.<br><br>Our commitment to human rights for all people living with disability underpins everything we do. We support people to achieve the goals they choose and live the life that they want, the person comes first!<br><br>Melba won the 2023 National Disability Award for Excellence in Service Quality.<br><br><strong>What is the Melba Way? <br><br></strong>Melba's approach is built on a human rights values-based framework. Our purpose is to open up a world of opportunities for people to live a fabulous life. The Melba Way' is how we go about doing this.<br><br>Each person is individual and unique.<br><br>The Melba Way honours and sustains this by creating, maintaining, and refining individualised person-led service, minute by minute, hour by hour and day by day.<br><br>We do this one person at a time.<br><br><strong>Position Purpose <br><br></strong>Working under the direction of the Head of Data &amp; Insights this position will build, test and continuously improve the data platform and analytics capability within Melba. Collaborating with key stakeholders this position will focus on translating business needs into actionable data solutions by developing, enhancing, and maintaining robust data platforms, reporting tools, and visualisations. The role will also support strategic decision-making and operational efficiency by gathering requirements, analysing data, automating workflows, and ensuring data governance, while promoting continuous improvement and alignment with business objectives.<br><br><strong>What You'll Be Doing (Key Accountabilities)<br><br></strong><strong>Stakeholder Engagement &amp; Requirements Gathering <br><br></strong><ul><li>Collaborate with stakeholders to identify business challenges and translate them into data and insights to support data based decision making </li><li>Collaborate with key stakeholders and departments during system implementations to define reporting needs and identify the most effective solutions. </li><li>Partner with technical and non-technical teams to ensure shared understanding of requirements, data, and goals for alignment on delivery. Collaborate closely with the Head of Data &amp; Insights to support strategic priorities and ensure that platform enhancements align with business objectives. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Data Platform Development &amp; Enhancement <br><br></strong><ul><li>Gather, clean, and analyse data from various sources to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights. </li><li>Perform exploratory data analysis to support strategic and operational decision-making. </li><li>Monitor and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) to provide visibility into business performance. </li><li>Write clean, modular Python code to automate data processing tasks and integrate disparate data sources. </li><li>Build reusable scripts and functions to support ad hoc and automated reporting needs. </li><li>Collaborate with BI developers and analysts to align backend data models with dashboard/reporting requirements. </li><li>Proactively identify and implement opportunities to optimise data workflows, automate manual processes, and improve system integration. </li><li>Document code, workflows, and data definitions to support platform maintainability and knowledge sharing. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Reporting &amp; Visualisation <br><br></strong><ul><li>Design and deliver dashboards, reports, and visualisations aligned to stakeholder needs. </li><li>Support the design and implementation of data models, KPIs, and reporting solutions. </li><li>Ensure that all reports and analyses comply with company policies and industry standards. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Process JD013.title: Business Analyst
JD013.location: Millers Point, New South Wales, Australia
JD013.description: Company DescriptionAt Sydney Airport, the future of air travel is shaped by you.As a team, we connect the world. More than just a hub of activity and boundless energy, we’re creating a destination of amazing experiences. Like seeing wonderful moments unfold in front of you, knowing “I made that possible!”.Dynamic. Fast-paced. We thrive in a place where fresh challenges land daily. Backed by positive and supportive team players and inspiring leaders, we adapt to change. Driven to grow. Owning every action. To do things better.As smart, problem-solvers, we are always learning and growing. And that’s easier to do alongside passionate experts, as we collaborate across teams readily sharing our knowledge.Each day is a new journey, as we bring an exciting vision to life. With significant capital investment in new, improved infrastructure, there’s never been a better time to expand your potential at Sydney Airport. The range of responsibilities and diverse pathways you can take on with us, are surprising.We are SYD. United in the pride that comes with welcoming the world at Australia’s premier gateway.Job DescriptionAbout the RoleA Business Analyst at SYD plays a critical role in bridging the gap between business needs and technology solutions. This role is responsible for identifying, analysing and translating business requirements into functional and non-functional specifications to support the design and delivery of technology solutions. Working closely with stakeholders across the airport, the Business Analyst ensures that technology solutions are aligned with strategic objectives, enhance operational efficiency and deliver measurable value.Key Responsibilities Will IncludeEngaging and maintaining strong, ongoing communication with all stakeholders to align on project goals, priorities and outcomesLeading the gathering, analysis and validation of business requirements, identifying challenges and opportunities for improvementOrganising and facilitating workshops and meetings to gather requirementsEvaluating and recommending process improvements, utilising process modelling techniques where appropriateTracking and measuring business value throughout the project lifecycle, ensuring alignment with expected benefitsDeveloping and championing business analysis standards, tools and methodologies to drive consistency, quality and best practice across the organisationAbout YouDegree in Business, Information Technology, or a related degreeMinimum 5 years’ experience in business and process analysis within a technology environmentStrong judgement and professionalism, with the ability to manage multiple competing prioritiesExperience with change management highly regardedExposure to OT systems or technologies such as SCADA, CCTV, access control, and passenger flow analytics.Proven ability to break down complex problems, identify patters and derive insightsStrong written and verbal communication with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholdersStrong skills in eliciting, documenting and validating business requirementsAdaptable and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environmentWhat We OfferTo find out more about the amazing work environment here at SYD, be sure to check out the Join us section of Sydney Airport’s website, where you can also see more about our flexible culture and work practices, alongside our other Employee benefits, or take a look at our LinkedIn Sydney Airport: Life page.Make it AmazingSYD is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages all suitably qualified applicants to apply, including First Nations Australians, and people from culturally diverse backgrounds

JD014.title: (Senior) Strategy Associate (Management Consulting, Hong Kong based)
JD014.description: What to ExpectWork on high-impact and diverse projects- You will have the opportunity to advise management on emerging industry trends and key business decisions, optimize key processes, and orchestrate key initiatives. Your work will be important to our business growth and sustainability, and cover a broad spectrum of topics.Own your initiative from end to end- You get to experience the full product cycle - from conception of an idea, to product launch, and ongoing KPI monitoring. You get to see the results of your recommendations & decisions with live data reporting. You get to truly own initiatives that you help to design & continuously improve, from end to end.Learn something new every day- Most if not all projects atCrypto.comare cross-functional, meaning you will be sitting at a roundtable or brainstorming on a whiteboard with colleagues & experts from diverse backgrounds - blockchain engineering, mobile development, design, cybersecurity, customer acquisition, fraud management, banking & finance…What You’ll DoIn this role, you will spearhead the strategic direction of our core products including our Main App Trading, Loyalty Programs, VISA Card and Pay, among others. Below are some activities you may find yourself doing:Strategic Visionary:Assisting the Strategy team to conceptualize, execute and monitor key strategic initiatives aimed at driving commercial successSubject Matter Expertise: Develop deep subject matter expertise in Crypto CEX trading, Loyalty Program Design, Crypto Payments and other relevant domainsPricing Strategy Optimization: Developing optimal pricing strategies for our all core products (proficiency in Excel modeling and generating data-driven insights is expected)Market Research & Analysis:Developing thematic research memos to advise on market/ sub-sector strategy;Project Coordination & Management: Coordinating cross-functional projects end-to-end from timeline/ deliverable planning to tracking/ reporting;Product Development: Designing & drafting requirements for a new product or feature;Performance Evaluation & Optimization: Deciding & analyzing product KPIs and recommending improvements to drive revenue and user engagementStrategic Partnerships & Investments: Evaluating & driving strategic and investment opportunitiesBusiness Projection & Analysis: Projecting business results and engage in strategic discussions with management regarding implications & strategic pivotsOverall, you will shoulder the important responsibilities of:(a) At a product level: Design & drive new features to success,(b) At a company level: Define & align business priorities with management, and(c) At an industry level: Generate insights & your own views on the marketWhat We Look ForBelow are some key traits we look for, and a list of indicators we watch out for during our screening. (Note that the list is not exhaustive, nor do we expect candidates to possess all traits at the same time.) We value the ability & drive to learn over past experience, as we believe in investing in learning of our teamIntellectual prowess & curiosity1-3 years of work experience in a field requiring strong problem-solving skills, e.g., management consulting, investment banking, venture capital, equity research;Highly structured approach in thinking, analysis and output generation;Quick learner who is able to translate newly acquired knowledge into actionable insights;Proven ability to take initiative and be proactive in identifying and addressing challenges or opportunities, consistently anticipating and acting upon business needs(Plus) Strong modeling skills;(Plus) Strong curiosity and a passion for continuous learning(Plus) Proficiency in SQL and Tableau(Plus) Track record in an extracurricular activity/ hobby, e.g., writing, arts, sports, etc.;Literacy in oral & written communicationExcellent command of English;Clarity, conciseness and confidence in communication, e.g., experience communicating with senior stakeholders, public presentations and/ or teaching, a portfolio of writing samples, etcOwnership, agility & teamworkPursuit of excellence, always going the extra mile to level up the quality of insights and deliverables;Self-driven and organized, with a relentless focus on following through on alignments and delivering results effectively;High-level of adaptability, being able to quickly reprioritize and iterate based on latest developments;Excellent attention to detail;Collaborative approach to teamwork, demonstrated through coordinating a complex project across multiple work-streams, leading a project team, etc.;(Plus) Experience working with teams from diverse backgrounds, e.g., cross-cultural, cross-industryLife @Crypto.comEmpowered to think big. Try new opportunities while working with a talented, ambitious and supportive team.Transformational and proactive working environment. Elevate employees to find thoughtful and innovative solutions.Growth from within. We help to develop new skill-sets that would impact the shaping of your personal and professional growth.Work Culture. Our colleagues are some of the best in the industry; we are all here to help and support one another.One cohesive team. Engage stakeholders to achieve our ultimate goal - Cryptocurrency in every wallet.Are you ready to kickstart your future with us?BenefitsCompetitive salaryMedical insurance package with extended coverage to dependentsAttractive annual leave entitlement including: birthday, work anniversaryWork Flexibility Adoption. Flexi-work hour and hybrid or remote set-upAspire career alternatives through us. Our internal mobility program can offer employees a diverse scope.Work Perks:crypto.comvisa card provided upon joiningOurCrypto.combenefits packages vary depending on region requirements, you can learn more from our talent acquisition team.AboutCrypto.com:Founded in 2016,Crypto.comserves more than 80 million customers and is the world's fastest growing global cryptocurrency platform. Our vision is simple: Cryptocurrency in Every Wallet™. Built on a foundation of security, privacy, and compliance,Crypto.comis committed to accelerating the adoption of cryptocurrency through innovation and empowering the next generation of builders, creators, and entrepreneurs to develop a fairer and more equitable digital ecosystem.Learn more athttps://crypto.com.Crypto.comis an equal opportunities employer and we are committed to creating an environment where opportunities are presented to everyone in a fair and transparent way.Crypto.comvalues diversity and inclusion, seeking candidates with a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills that complement and strengthen our team.Personal data provided by applicants will be used for recruitment purposes only.

JD015.title: (Senior) Strategy Associate (Management Consulting, Hong Kong based)
JD015.description: What to ExpectWork on high-impact and diverse projects- You will have the opportunity to advise management on emerging industry trends and key business decisions, optimize key processes, and orchestrate key initiatives. Your work will be important to our business growth and sustainability, and cover a broad spectrum of topics.Own your initiative from end to end- You get to experience the full product cycle - from conception of an idea, to product launch, and ongoing KPI monitoring. You get to see the results of your recommendations & decisions with live data reporting. You get to truly own initiatives that you help to design & continuously improve, from end to end.Learn something new every day- Most if not all projects atCrypto.comare cross-functional, meaning you will be sitting at a roundtable or brainstorming on a whiteboard with colleagues & experts from diverse backgrounds - blockchain engineering, mobile development, design, cybersecurity, customer acquisition, fraud management, banking & finance…What You’ll DoIn this role, you will spearhead the strategic direction of our core products including our Main App Trading, Loyalty Programs, VISA Card and Pay, among others. Below are some activities you may find yourself doing:Strategic Visionary:Assisting the Strategy team to conceptualize, execute and monitor key strategic initiatives aimed at driving commercial successSubject Matter Expertise: Develop deep subject matter expertise in Crypto CEX trading, Loyalty Program Design, Crypto Payments and other relevant domainsPricing Strategy Optimization: Developing optimal pricing strategies for our all core products (proficiency in Excel modeling and generating data-driven insights is expected)Market Research & Analysis:Developing thematic research memos to advise on market/ sub-sector strategy;Project Coordination & Management: Coordinating cross-functional projects end-to-end from timeline/ deliverable planning to tracking/ reporting;Product Development: Designing & drafting requirements for a new product or feature;Performance Evaluation & Optimization: Deciding & analyzing product KPIs and recommending improvements to drive revenue and user engagementStrategic Partnerships & Investments: Evaluating & driving strategic and investment opportunitiesBusiness Projection & Analysis: Projecting business results and engage in strategic discussions with management regarding implications & strategic pivotsOverall, you will shoulder the important responsibilities of:(a) At a product level: Design & drive new features to success,(b) At a company level: Define & align business priorities with management, and(c) At an industry level: Generate insights & your own views on the marketWhat We Look ForBelow are some key traits we look for, and a list of indicators we watch out for during our screening. (Note that the list is not exhaustive, nor do we expect candidates to possess all traits at the same time.) We value the ability & drive to learn over past experience, as we believe in investing in learning of our teamIntellectual prowess & curiosity1-3 years of work experience in a field requiring strong problem-solving skills, e.g., management consulting, investment banking, venture capital, equity research;Highly structured approach in thinking, analysis and output generation;Quick learner who is able to translate newly acquired knowledge into actionable insights;Proven ability to take initiative and be proactive in identifying and addressing challenges or opportunities, consistently anticipating and acting upon business needs(Plus) Strong modeling skills;(Plus) Strong curiosity and a passion for continuous learning(Plus) Proficiency in SQL and Tableau(Plus) Track record in an extracurricular activity/ hobby, e.g., writing, arts, sports, etc.;Literacy in oral & written communicationExcellent command of English;Clarity, conciseness and confidence in communication, e.g., experience communicating with senior stakeholders, public presentations and/ or teaching, a portfolio of writing samples, etcOwnership, agility & teamworkPursuit of excellence, always going the extra mile to level up the quality of insights and deliverables;Self-driven and organized, with a relentless focus on following through on alignments and delivering results effectively;High-level of adaptability, being able to quickly reprioritize and iterate based on latest developments;Excellent attention to detail;Collaborative approach to teamwork, demonstrated through coordinating a complex project across multiple work-streams, leading a project team, etc.;(Plus) Experience working with teams from diverse backgrounds, e.g., cross-cultural, cross-industryLife @Crypto.comEmpowered to think big. Try new opportunities while working with a talented, ambitious and supportive team.Transformational and proactive working environment. Elevate employees to find thoughtful and innovative solutions.Growth from within. We help to develop new skill-sets that would impact the shaping of your personal and professional growth.Work Culture. Our colleagues are some of the best in the industry; we are all here to help and support one another.One cohesive team. Engage stakeholders to achieve our ultimate goal - Cryptocurrency in every wallet.Are you ready to kickstart your future with us?BenefitsCompetitive salaryMedical insurance package with extended coverage to dependentsAttractive annual leave entitlement including: birthday, work anniversaryWork Flexibility Adoption. Flexi-work hour and hybrid or remote set-upAspire career alternatives through us. Our internal mobility program can offer employees a diverse scope.Work Perks:crypto.comvisa card provided upon joiningOurCrypto.combenefits packages vary depending on region requirements, you can learn more from our talent acquisition team.AboutCrypto.com:Founded in 2016,Crypto.comserves more than 80 million customers and is the world's fastest growing global cryptocurrency platform. Our vision is simple: Cryptocurrency in Every Wallet™. Built on a foundation of security, privacy, and compliance,Crypto.comis committed to accelerating the adoption of cryptocurrency through innovation and empowering the next generation of builders, creators, and entrepreneurs to develop a fairer and more equitable digital ecosystem.Learn more athttps://crypto.com.Crypto.comis an equal opportunities employer and we are committed to creating an environment where opportunities are presented to everyone in a fair and transparent way.Crypto.comvalues diversity and inclusion, seeking candidates with a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills that complement and strengthen our team.Personal data provided by applicants will be used for recruitment purposes only.

JD016.title: Business Intelligence Analyst
JD016.description: Company DescriptionFor over 50 years, Each has stood beside individuals and communities, helping people live healthier, more fulfilling lives.We put people at the heart of everything we do, surrounding them with a network of care and support that empowers individuals to thrive.Join us and be part of a team that delivers Altogether Better Care—because when we come together, we create brighter futures for all.Job DescriptionFull-time ongoing position based at Ringwood HQ with flexible hybrid optionsFamily-friendly workplace with autonomy and meaningful community impact at its coreNot-for-profit benefits: Salary Packaging of up to $18,550Salary: $52.13ph + 12% SuperAre you an experienced BI professional looking for a meaningful role with purpose, flexibility, and autonomy?At Each, we’re seeking someone who brings deep experience in business intelligence and a desire to make a difference. You’ll use your expertise to transform complex data into insights that improve lives, all while enjoying the autonomy, balance, and supportive culture of a purpose-driven not-for-profit.Key Responsibilities:Develop, maintain and enhance Power BI dashboards that support organisational priorities.Work with stakeholders to analyse large, complex datasets and extract actionable insights.Promote and support a self-service data culture by enabling non-technical users through training, intuitive visualisations, and accessible tools.Monitor data quality and collaborate with teams to address inconsistencies and drive continuous improvement.Translate complex business needs into elegant BI solutions that inform clinical, compliance, and funding reporting.Identify key performance indicators, trends, and risks to support service effectiveness.Drive automation, process improvement, and documentation for BI systems.To view the full Position Description,here. For more information, please contact Nick Richards (Team Lead - Digital & DataInformation Technology) at nick.richards@each.com.auAbout YouYou’re a seasoned data professional who’s:Highly skilled in Power BI, SQL, DAX, and data modelling (Microsoft Fabric experience a bonus).Strong communication skills and comfortable explaining technical concepts in plain language.A proven ability to lead and promote change specifically in the area of data self-service.Collaborative, adaptable, and focused on practical, real-world outcomes.Self-motivated and looking for a role where trust, flexibility, and autonomy are the norm.Aligned with Each’s mission to improve health and wellbeing in the community.What You BringExtensive experience working with complex datasets and developing interactive BI dashboards.Strong background in stakeholder engagement and data storytelling.Proven track record in compliance/reporting frameworks — ideally in health, NFP, or community sectors.Sound knowledge of data ethics and best-practice reporting.QualificationsA relevant qualification in Data Analytics, IT, or related field – or equivalent professional experience.Certification in Power BI or Microsoft data tools (desirable).Additional skills in programming languages such as Python highly regarded.Additional InformationWhy Choose Each?Balance your way: Family friendly and flexible work arrangements to help you juggle work and life commitments.Belonging & Inclusion: We celebrate all backgrounds, abilities, and identities and ensure a culturally safe environment.Supportive Team Culture: Be part of a purpose-driven team where people genuinely care.Boost your take-home pay: Not-for-Profit Salary Packaging (up to $15,900 tax-free per year) plus an extra $2,650 tax-free for meals and entertainment.Wellbeing Support: Free, confidential counselling for you and your family.More leave when you need it: 4 weeks annual leave, sick/carer’s leave, family & domestic violence leave, and the option to purchase extra leave.Get paid more on your holidays: 17% annual leave loading. (this is only for some roles)Ready to Make a Difference?🕓Applications Close:Sunday 20th July 2025(Please note: interviews may occur as applications are received.)Next Steps in the Hiring ProcessThank you for your interest in joining Each! To learn more about next steps, please check out our Hiring Process Guide.We are a 2025 Circle Back Initiative Employer - we commit to respond to every applicant.Didn’t find the perfect role today? Stay connected by joining our Talent Community — be the first to hear about new opportunities at Each!

JD017.title: Commercial BI Analyst
JD017.description: About UsFounded in the Queensland outback in 1920, Qantas has grown to be Australia’s largest regional, domestic, and international airline. Qantas has a range of subsidiary businesses that support the overall operations of the Group. The Qantas Group’s main business is the transportation of customers and freight using two complementary airline brands — Qantas and Jetstar — operating regional, domestic, and international services.Job DescriptionDesign and implement solutions across all stages of the data lifecycle, from sourcing and validation to visualisation and insight generationDevelop and automate dashboards and reporting to monitor commercial KPIs and support strategic decision-makingProvide data-driven insights and modelling to inform short- and long-term commercial strategies across Sales & Distribution and the Qantas GroupPermanent role based at our Mascot CampusWe’ve always been pioneers, and we’re proud to see that spirit in our people today. Our resilience has helped us through good and tough times, and it still drives us to keep pushing the challenging expectations today.We're looking for an analytically mindedCommercial BI Analystto join our Sales & Distribution team. In this dynamic role, you'll design and implement end-to-end solutions to source, validate and operationalise complex data flows. You’ll use these systems to create and automate dashboards and reporting to monitor key commercial KPIs and support strategic decision making. You’ll generate and communicate actionable insights that drive the performance of key commercial metrics, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives. You’ll play a crucial role in supporting the Sales Performance team through data modelling and project-based analysis, driving both short- and long-term strategy across the Qantas Group’s Sales functions.To succeed, you'll need to bring a sharp commercial mindset, strong communication skills and a flair for storytelling with data. Your ability to influence senior stakeholders and translate insights into strategic recommendations will directly impact revenue performance and commercial outcomes.You’ll have –Minimum 5 years’ experience in a similar or related data analytics, business intelligence, or commercial role.Tertiary qualifications in data science, business or a related field.Advanced technical and analytical skills, with strong problem-solving ability and commercial acumen.Expertise in design and building dynamic Power BI visualisations and ad hoc reporting tools.Proficiency with SQL, Excel and PowerPoint, with experience sourcing and integrating data from internal systems.Skills in analysing complex data sets and identifying key performance drivers, with the ability to translate insights into actionable business recommendations.Keen interest in data quality, with a passion for uncovering and resolving underlying data issues.Strong verbal and written communication skills, including presenting insights to senior stakeholders and influencing decision-making.The ability to confidently challenge the status quo, encouraging the business to improve processes and deliver more efficient solutions.Proven ability to manage competing priorities and collaborate effectively across functions to deliver timely, accurate reporting and drive commercial performance.Why Qantas?You’ll join a team where creativity and passion are encouraged. Our people come together to allow us to dream big and deliver successfully.There are many different opportunities across our team, which means you’ll be able to grow both personally and professionally at Qantas. Your development is a priority for us – so that you can maintain the high standards our customers have come to expect and can continue to develop over time. You’ll be supported from day 1 with on the job training and coaching as well as our formal training opportunities. While you may start in this role, we’ve got a great track record of supporting our people to take their career in so many different directions, the destinations are endless.The Qantas employee benefits program offers amazing benefits that extend well beyond travel.We love to travel: Enjoy heavily discounted air travel within Australia and across the globe, both for you and your family and friends, as well as exclusive deals on accommodation and holidays.We have flexible leave options: Make use of leave and flexible working opportunities including 18 weeks paid parental leave (plus superannuation payments on all paid and unpaid parental leave until your child turns 1) and additional purchased leave options for eligible employees.We’ll give you access to thousands of rewards: Through our partnerships we can offer you discounts across shopping, food and wine, insurance, health and wellbeing, leisure and entertainment. You can also take advantage of our salary packaging program including motor vehicles, eligible portable electronic devices and professional memberships.We’ll support your wellbeing: Whether it’s learning to better support your own and others’ mental health, our interactive wellbeing app or your very own tailored nutrition plan.Qantas is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, and people of all backgrounds to apply. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application. Your personal information will be kept confidential in compliance with relevant privacy legislation.Be a part of something special and play your part in the Qantas story – get in touch today.Applications close Wednesday 16th JulyPlease note: applications will only be considered for candidates who have the right to work in Australia / New Zealand without restriction or sponsorship.

JD018.title: Customer Data Analyst
JD018.description: Ready to turn data into powerful customer experiences?AtMazda Australia, we’re passionate about delivering exceptional customer experiences. OurDigital Innovation teamleads the way in using data to drive impactful marketing and customer engagement initiatives. We’re looking for aCustomer Data Analystto join our dynamic team and support our CRM programs by providing essential data analysis and insights.About the Role:As aCustomer Data Analyst, you’ll ensure the accuracy and impact of our CRM initiatives by extracting, analysing, and reporting customer data to support campaigns. Working with Digital Innovation and ISD teams, you’ll develop and test scripts to maintain CRM integrity. Using Oracle SQL and Power BI, you’ll track performance and provide insights to guide future strategies.This position requires a full-time, in-office presencefive daysa week at our Mazda Australia Head Office in Mulgrave, fostering a collaborative work environment and promoting effective teamwork.​Key Responsibilities:Data Extraction & Campaign Support: Extract data for marketing campaigns, ensuring accuracy and timely delivery.Campaign Development: Collaborate with the Digital Innovation team to script, test, and maintain CRM systems.System Support & Analysis: Manage SQL scripts for campaign activation and coordinate with ISD on technical requirements.Post-Campaign Reporting: Deliver detailed performance analysis, including customer engagement metrics and sales attribution.Process Improvement: Support the enhancement of CRM processes, data integrity, and system development initiatives.About you:Are you skilled in Oracle SQL and Excel, familiar with CRM and analytics tools, and passionate about turning data into meaningful business insights? If so, we want you on our team!To be successful, you will have:1–2 years’ experience with Oracle SQL and strong proficiency in MS Excel for data analysis.Familiarity with CRM systems (Eloqua preferred) and analytics tools such as Power BI.Tertiary qualification in a business-related field or equivalent.Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively across departments.A passion for leveraging data to drive business outcomes and enhance customer experiences.About Mazda Australia:Welcome to Mazda Australia, where innovation and passion converge to redefine the automotive experience. As a key player in the Mazda Motor Corporation, we're committed to crafting vehicles that embody style, performance, and cutting-edge technology. Join our team and be part of a legacy that drives excellence on the roads and in the hearts of driving enthusiasts.Mazda Australia Benefits:New Car Discounts, participation in theEmployee Demo Vehicle Program (discounted lease car options)andNew Vehicle Drive Programs.Annual bonus eligibilityand17.5% annual leave loading.Access toweekend loan cars, uniform allowance, onsite subsidised café, and additional perks.PaidParental Leave.Join a collaborative team and supportive team culture.Ongoinglearning and development opportunitiesto fuel your career growth.Wellness Programs throughout the year, Skin Checks, Annual Flu Vaccinations, Employee Assistance Program and Health Care provider discounts.If you’re ready for a challenge, apply today to connect your vision with ours. Discover more about us and seize this opportunity!Application and Selection Process:We value attitudes, behaviours, and values that align with Mazda Australia’s culture. Applicants will be subject to a police check, reference checks, and online psychometric assessment.We thank you for your application, please note only shortlisted and candidates with full working rights in Australia will be contacted.
